snippet: Despite the C.I.A.'s concerns, a Port Authority officer working with the F.B.I. kept ties to sources inside the Sunni terrorist group Jundallah.
abstract: Unusual origins and long-running nature of relationship between United States and Sunni terrorist group Jundullah are emblematic of vast expansion of intelligence operations since terrorist attacks of Sept 11, 2001; relationship with group stemmed from Thomas McHale, detective with Port Authority of New York and New Jersey and member of FBI counterterrorism task force, who had developed informants within the organization.

byline.original: By JAMES RISEN and MATT APUZZO

lead_paragraph: Despite the C.I.A.'s concerns, a Port Authority officer working with the F.B.I. kept ties to sources inside the Sunni terrorist group Jundallah.

headline.seo: Port Authority Officer Kept Sources With Ties to Iran Attacks
headline.main: Getting Close to Terror, but Not to Stop It
headline.print_headline: Getting Close to Terror, but Not to Stop It

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
